title: X-59 Fires Up its Engine for First Time on Its Way to Takeoff
summary: NASA’s Quesst mission marked a major milestone with the start of tests on the engine that will power the quiet supersonic X-59 experimental aircraft. These engine-run tests, which began Oct. 30, allow the X-59 team to verify the aircraft’s systems are working together while powered by its own engine. In previous tests, the X-59 used […]

title: NASA Knows – How Can I Get Involved With NASA Research?
summary: NASA provides a variety of pathways for those outside the agency to contribute to authentic and meaningful research. Whether you’re a student pursuing a degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, or mathematics), an educator looking for new ways to engage your classroom, or a citizen scientist enthusiastic about sharing your observations, there’s a wide array […]

title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Completes MIRA II Rocket-Powered Roll Test
summary: Bremen-based POLARIS Spaceplanes has completed a rocket-powered roll test of its MIRA II demonstrator. The test represented the last major milestone before the company attempts the vehicle’s first rocket-powered flight. MIRA II is one of a pair of identical vehicles that POLARIS began developing after the original MIRA demonstrator was damaged following a take-off incident […]

title: Restoring NASA’s original mission
summary: As a new administration steps in, America’s space program stands at a crossroads. We have an opportunity to refocus NASA on its founding mission: advancing technological leadership and driving economic growth through space exploration. Programs like NASA’s Technology Transfer and Commercial Orbital Transportation Services (COTS) showcase the agency’s power to transform innovations into economic benefits and foster a thriving commercial space industry. But to fully realize this potential, NASA needs leaders with hands-on expertise in rapidly evolving fields, capable of steering the agency toward transformative, forward-looking projects.

title: Latitude Names New CEO Ahead of Zephyr Rocket’s Inaugural Flight
summary: French launch provider Latitude has announced that co-founder and current CEO Stanislas Maximin will transition to an executive chairman role, while industry veteran Aurélie Bressollette steps in as the new CEO. title: Japan, Poland to join U.S. military satellite network
summary: Both nations have reached new agreements with the U.S. to gain access to the Wideband Global Satcom (WGS) satellite system

title: Gilmour Space secures license for first orbital launch
summary: Australian launch vehicle startup Gilmour Space has received a license for its first orbital launch, which could take place before the end of the year.
